question: Which branch of forensics deals with performing autopsies and determining the cause of death?
What is the main aim to perform an autopsy?

answers.option: To identify the cause of death
To look for signs of life
To look for any possible injuries

question: An eight-year-old girl was brought to ENT OPD with complaints of fever, rash, and cough. During the oral examination, the doctor noticed bright red lesions with white dots on the girl's buccal mucosa. Her mother mentioned the rash first appeared on the face and then spread to the extremities, including palms and soles. Which one of the following viruses is the most probable cause of infection?

A 5-year-old boy was brought to the OPD with complaints of water-filled blisters on his whole body including trunk and both upper and lower extremities. He also complained of severe itching along with fever ad malaise. On clinical grounds doctor suspected him to be suffering with varicella. A presumptive diagnosis of his condition can be made by which of the following techniques?
During the first week of symptoms caused by Salmonella typhi, what specimen/specimens could be collected for the routine diagnosis of enteric fever?

answers.option: Widal test for detection of antibodies
PCR for bacterial isolation from serum sample

question: A 35-year-old female patient presented with fever, chills, sweating, and headache, weakness, presumptively diagnosed as "viral syndrome." Later, the patient deteriorated with an altered level of consciousness, severe anemia, renal failure, and multisystem failure. Blood samples were sent for lab investigations including malarial parasites. Crescent or sausage (banana) shaped gametocytes are characteristic features of which of the plasmodium species?

A 6-year-old boy presents with fever, malaise, cough, running nose and conjunctivitis. The boy does not receive any childhood vaccination. On examination, his temperature is 102.7 F and there are white spots on a red base close to his second molar teeth. He also has a non-pruritic, maculopapular rash on his face, behind his ears, and spreading to his chest. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 29-year-old businessman presents with flu-like symptoms, splenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, and fever along with a weight loss of 12 kg. He acknowledges promiscuous behavior with numerous girls during his travel to different countries which raises suspicion of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). What is the name of the co-receptor required for macrophage-tropic HIV to gain entry into the host cell?

A 14-year-old girl comes to the outpatient department concerned about the white patch on her face for two years. On examination, there is a well-demarcated hypopigmented area of skin which is non-responsive to painful stimuli. What test you would prescribe to diagnose such a case?
Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) is mainly transmitted to humans through:
What does the term bactericidal mean in the context of treating bacterial infections?

answers.option: Drugs that inhibit the growth of bacteria
Antimicrobial drugs that eradicate bacterial infection/kill bacteria

question: Which of the following penicillin is an example of a narrow-spectrum antibiotic?
Which of the following statements is correct about vancomycin?

answers.option: Binds to penicillin binding protein for its mechanism of action
Has a very good oral bioavailability

question: A 43-year-old man presented with a 3-day history of peri-umbilical pain which had localized to the right iliac fossa by the time he attended hospital. He described the pain as sharp, constant, and aggravated by movement. Examination findings revealed a soft abdomen with tenderness and guarding in the right iliac fossa. The physician suspected him of acute appendicitis. Which one of the following would be raised in acute appendicitis?

A 23-year-old lady has been complaining of right quadrant pain for the last two days. Rebound tenderness was observed on physical examination. Laparoscopic surgery was planned and swollen; reddish appendix was removed. Histopathological biopsy showed numerous infiltrations of neutrophils. Which one of the following mediators is responsible for causing pain?

A 35-year-old man presents to the emergency department with complaints of fever, malaise, and cough associated with severe pain in muscles and joints. His CBC report shows leucopenia and thrombocytopenia. The serological test report shows NS1 antigen-positive. The patient is suffering from which one of the following infectious diseases?

A 35-year-old male presented with a one-and-half-year history of pruritus, swelling, and pain involving the distal extremities and the ears. Physical examinations revealed nonpitting edema of the ears, bilateral loss of eyelashes, and ill-defined somewhat dusky, hyperpigmented patches scattered diffusely and symmetrically on his extremities with sparing of the trunk and neck. Histopathology of the skin biopsy demonstrated granulomatous infiltrates, with perineural and perivascular involvement, and a large number of acid-fast bacilli on the Ziehle Neelsen stain. What would be the diagnosis?

A 68-year-old man has had dyspnea for 3 years without any history of cough and fever. He worked in coal mines for the last 10 years. A chest x-ray shows prominent interstitial markings with nodules. Which one of the following is an identifying feature of his condition?
Leishmaniasis is a disease caused by the protozoan Leishmania. During visceral leishmaniasis which organs in the human body are commonly affected?
Which of the following antibiotics can cause Fanconi Syndrome when expired:

A premature neonate suffered respiratory distress and was given an antibiotic 100 mg/kg/day orally. Over the next two days his condition worsened, he became dull, stopped feeding, and developed abdominal distention and an ashen gray appearance. Which is the most likely antibiotic given to him?
Which of the following antibiotics acts by inhibiting nucleic acid synthesis?
The most important dose-dependent toxicity of dapsone is:

A traveler in a geographical region where chloroquine-resistant Plasmodium falciparum is endemic used a drug for prophylaxis but nevertheless developed a severe attack of P vivax malaria. The drug taken for chemoprophylaxis was probably:

A 20-year-old agricultural laborer from Brazil came with a history of progressive weakness and abdominal discomfort associated with loss of appetite for six months. On examination there was hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow smears revealed an abundance of amastigotes both intracellularly within the macrophages as well as extracellularly. What is the likely diagnosis?

A male patient presents with lower abdominal discomfort, flatulence, and occasional diarrhea. A diagnosis of intestinal amebiasis is made, and Entamoeba histolytica is identified in his diarrheal stools. The preferred treatment that he should have received for the initial symptoms (which were indicative of mild-to-moderate disease) is:

A 36-year-old male presented to the emergency department with a fever lasting for three days, accompanied by mild abdominal pain. Upon examination, he exhibited a fever of 103°F and jaundice, along with a palpable spleen. A peripheral blood film revealed the presence of trophozoites of Plasmodium falciparum. What is the preferred treatment for uncomplicated falciparum malaria?

A 30-year-old previously healthy male presents to the emergency department with a fever. He reports feeling generally unwell for the past three days, with associated chills and sweating. On examination, his temperature is 39.2°C (102.5°F), heart rate 100 bpm, respiratory rate 18 breaths/min, blood pressure 120/80 mmHg, and oxygen saturation 98% on room air. He appears tired but is alert and oriented. His physical examination is unremarkable, with no focal signs of infection. What is the most appropriate next step in the evaluation of this patient?

answers.option: Order a complete blood count (CBC) with differential
Start antipyretic medication and reassess after 24 hours

question: An 18-year-old girl college student came to OPD with a complaint of fever. She looks well on the examination. She has an absence of sweating during defervescence and has a bizarre temperature chart with the absence of diurnal variation or temperature-related change in pulse rate. She has normal ESR and CRP. A few scars of self-harm were noticed on the left wrist. What is the most likely type of fever in her case?

A 30-year-old female with a history of rheumatoid arthritis, currently on long-term steroid therapy, presents to the emergency room with a high-grade fever (maximum temperature of 103°F) that has persisted for four days. She subsequently developed a maculopapular rash that began on her face and chest and has now generalized. Additionally, she has been experiencing difficulty breathing and a dry cough for the past day. Upon examination, she is afebrile and has a red-purple rash, while bilateral coarse crackles were audible during auscultation. What is the likely diagnosis?
An 18-year-old boy with a fever and a vesicular rash for 2 days is admitted to the ward. With suspicion of chicken pox what necessary precautions should be taken to avoid exposing other patients?

answers.option: Single room isolation and droplet precautions
Single room isolation, airborne and contact precautions

question: A 50-year-old male presented in OPD with hypopigmented lesions on his hands and forearms, especially the elbows. He also complains of loss of sensation in these lesions. On examination, there is a loss of pinprick sensation in the affected areas and his ulnar nerve is palpable under the elbow. How would you confirm your diagnosis?
A young patient presents with high-grade fever for 4 days and a generalized blanchable rash. What is the most appropriate diagnostic test for dengue at this stage?

A 22-year-old male presented to OPD with a complaint of burning micturition and urethral discharge for 5 days. He admits to having sexual exposure with a sexual worker 2 weeks back. The most common causative organism of urethral discharge is:

A young male comes to the physician with complaints of high-grade fever and swelling in front of both ears causing difficulty in mouth opening. On examination, bilateral painful parotid enlargement was there. What will be the possible diagnosis?

An 18-year-old male, who appeared disoriented, was brought to the Emergency Department due to a single episode of nosebleeding and continuous gum bleeding for the past six hours. His mother reported that he had experienced a high-grade fever and vomiting for the last three days. During the physical examination, the patient had a temperature of 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit, cold and clammy skin, a feeble pulse, and small red spots on his skin. What is considered the gold standard diagnostic test for this condition?

Transplantation terminology contains terms to describe the relationship of the graft donor to the graft recipient. The correct terminology for a graft between genetically non-identical members of the same species is:

A patient with a broken leg is being transported to the hospital in an ambulance. While crossing a signal, another vehicle unexpectedly collides with the ambulance, leading to the patient's death. In legal terms, which of the following best describes the cause of death?

A dying female victim of domestic violence, while in the hospital, recorded her deposition on oath in the presence of a magistrate and the accused, describing the circumstances of her impending death. Why does this deposition carry more legal weight than a dying declaration?

answers.option: It is recorded in the presence of the accused.
The oath of the dying person is an essential prerequisite.
It remains valid even after the recovery of the depositor.
It is recorded by a magistrate.

question: In a court of law, which of the following refers to all legal means used to establish the truth of a fact presented in judicial proceedings?
In which of the following situations is expressed oral consent typically required?

answers.option: Should be signed by both doctor and patient
Should be signed by doctor and patient in the presence of a 3rd party

question: In a court of law, during the recording of evidence, leading questions are typically only allowed during cross-examination. However, under what other condition can the prosecution ask leading questions?
Which type of euthanasia is accepted by professional medical societies and by law under certain circumstances?
In which case can patient confidentiality be breached:

answers.option: For a patient who requires invasive treatment
When the patient does not listen to the doctor
